email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope you're doing well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Oceanic Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and LOA of 280m. The laycan is 15-20 October. The starting freight quote is in the low 50s ($50.50 per metric ton). Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit higher than expected. Could you consider $49.75 per metric ton? Also, could you confirm the vessel’s availability and any demurrage terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I’ve checked with the owner, and we can offer $50.00 per metric ton as a counteroffer. The MV Oceanic Star is confirmed available for the laycan. Demurrage is set at $25,000 per day, pro rata. Let me know if this is acceptable. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $50.00 works for us. Let’s proceed with the MV Oceanic Star. Please confirm the laytime start and end dates, and share the draft charter party for review. Also, could you clarify if the demurrage rate is fixed or negotiable? Thanks, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear! The laytime will start on 15 October and end on 20 October. I’ll send the draft charter party shortly. The demurrage rate is fixed at $25,000 per day, but we can discuss further if there are specific concerns. Let me know if you need anything else. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the details. The laytime and demurrage terms are acceptable. Please proceed with the charter party, and let’s finalize the agreement. Looking forward to working with you on this shipment. Cheers, John
